User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the EduConnect Pro application. This can be a teacher, student, or parent.

role.description: The role of the user (teacher, student, parent).

Teacher.title: Teacher
Teacher.description: Represents a teacher in the EduConnect Pro application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Teacher entity.

verificationCode.description: Verification code assigned to the teacher.

subjects.description: Comma-separated list of subjects taught by the teacher.

className.description: The name of the class or coaching center.

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student in the EduConnect Pro application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher that accepted/enrolled this student.  Can be null for independent students. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N Student)

isApproved.description: Indicates whether the student has been approved by a teacher.

batch.description: The batch the student is assigned to.

Parent.title: Parent
Parent.description: Represents a parent in the EduConnect Pro application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Parent entity.

studentId.description: Reference to the student the parent is associated with. (Relationship: Student 1:N Parent)

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher that manages the student, used for read-only access. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N Parent)

StudyMaterial.title: StudyMaterial
StudyMaterial.description: Represents study material uploaded by a teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StudyMaterial entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher who uploaded the material. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N StudyMaterial)

uploadDate.description: Date and time when the material was uploaded.

type.description: The type of study material, such as 'notes', 'dpp', 'test', etc.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Attendance entity.

studentId.description: Reference to the student. (Relationship: Student 1:N Attendance)

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N Attendance)

isPresent.description: Indicates whether the student was present.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TestResult entity.

studentId.description: Reference to the student. (Relationship: Student 1:N TestResult)

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher. (Relationship: Teacher 1:N TestResult)

testId.description: Reference to the test. (Relationship: StudyMaterial 1:N TestResult. StudyMaterial.type must equal 'test')

Batch.title: Batch
Batch.description: Represents a batch of students created by a teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Batch entity.

teacherId.description: Reference to the teacher who created the batch.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support EduConnect Pro's requirements for role-based access, real-time updates, and study material management while adhering to the core design principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC, and QAPs. Authorization Independence is achieved through denormalization of authorization-related data (e.g., teacherId on student and parent documents) to avoid `get()` calls in security rules. Structural Segregation is used to ensure that each collection has a homogeneous security posture.  Path-based ownership and membership maps are leveraged for access modeling. All IDs are auto-generated UUIDs.

Specifically:

*   **Users**: Stores basic user information.  This collection is primarily used for authentication purposes and contains minimal data. The `users/{userId}` path provides a secure and easily managed structure for user-specific data.
*   **Teachers**: Contains teacher-specific details. The `teachers/{teacherId}` path ensures that teacher data is isolated and accessible only to authorized users.
*   **Students**: Stores student data, with a `teacherId` field denormalized for authorization. This allows students to be associated with teachers and enables efficient querying and rule creation based on teacher-student relationships.
*   **Parents**: Contains parent data, including references to both the student and teacher. The `teacherId` is denormalized to grant read-only access based on the teacher-student relationship, thus enabling authorization independence.
*   **StudyMaterials**: Contains study materials uploaded by teachers.  The `teacherId` ensures that only the teacher who uploaded the material can modify it. This supports the QAP that study materials are owned by teachers and enables secure listing.
*   **Attendances**: Stores attendance records for students, associated with a specific teacher.  This structure facilitates efficient querying of attendance records by student and teacher.
*   **TestResults**: Contains test results for students, also associated with the relevant teacher and test. The `teacherId` and `testId` ensure that only authorized teachers can access and modify test results, and that results can be easily queried by student, teacher, and test.
*   **Batches**: Stores batch information. This collection is managed by teachers to organize their students.
This design prioritizes data isolation and role-based access control, aligning with the application's security and scalability requirements.
